trans-unit.source: Provides data for the known, but unreferenced, object found in an encoded SOAP XML stream during deserialization.

For more information about the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.UnreferencedObjectEventArgs> class, see the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer.UnreferencedObject> event of the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer>.
The <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer.UnreferencedObject> event occurs only when you call the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer.Deserialize%2A> method.
For more information about handling events, see [Events Overview](~/docs/framework/winforms/events-overview-windows-forms.md)
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Xml.Serialization.UnreferencedObjectEventArgs"></xref> class.
A unique string used to identify the unreferenced object.
Gets the ID of the object.
Use the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.UnreferencedObjectEventArgs.UnreferencedId%2A> property when you need to know when more than one object raises the event.
The property allows you to distinguish between multiple instances of unreferenced objects.
For more information about the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.UnreferencedObjectEventArgs.UnreferencedId%2A> property, see the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer.UnreferencedObject> event.
Gets the deserialized, but unreferenced, object.
The <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.UnreferencedObjectEventArgs.UnreferencedObject%2A> can be cast to the known type if examining its properties is required.

See the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer.UnreferencedObject> event for more information about the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.UnreferencedObjectEventArgs.UnreferencedObject%2A> property.
